snippet: The United Nations’ deputy humanitarian coordinator for South Sudan said the humanitarian situation in the region was “grim” after the Lou Nuer ethnic group attacked the Murle group.
abstract: United Nations official Lise Grande calls humanitarian situation in South Sudan 'grim,' saying that tens and perhaps hundreds have been killed.
lead_paragraph: The United Nations’ deputy humanitarian coordinator for South Sudan said the humanitarian situation in the region was “grim” after the Lou Nuer ethnic group attacked the Murle group.

headline.seo: South Sudan Ethnic Clashes May Have Killed Hundreds, U.N. Says
headline.main: Fatal Ethnic Fights in South Sudan
headline.print_headline: Fatal Ethnic Fights In South Sudan

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
keywords.name: subject
